titleStmt.title: Paradisi in sole paradisus terrestris. or A garden of all sorts of pleasant flowers which our English ayre will permitt to be noursed vp with a kitchen garden of all manner of herbes, rootes, & fruites, for meate or sause vsed with vs, and an orchard of all sorte of fruitbearing trees and shrubbes fit for our land together with the right orderinge planting & preseruing of them and their vses & vertues collected by Iohn Parkinson apothecary of London 1629.
titleStmt.author: Parkinson, John, 1567-1650.
Switzer, A., wood-engraver.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Humfrey Lownes and Robert Young at the signe of the Starre on Bread-street hill,

notesStmt.note: The title page is xylographic and signed: A Switzer.
Printer's name and address from colophon.
A1r line 4 of heading ends "amend". Variant (actually intended for copies of STC 19301?): this quire reset, with A1r line 4 of heading ending "amend the".
Reproduction of the original in the Library of Congress.
